page.title: 13The Road out of FINTRY
page.content:
The{B818}running to the north of the Campsie Hills connects with the{A875} and forms a main route out of the village to Glasgow.
For most of the year it is a reasonably quiet alternative to the {Crow Road}which connects Fintry to Lennoxtown and so to Glasgow.
During the relatively short times when heavy snowfalls occur, the{B818}can become the only way in and out of the village. Happily such times are rare, but when it happens, the road cut by snow ploughs can be transformed, from a quiet summer drive to something more akin to the stage set for the Ice Maiden. At such times, unless you live here or have important business here, stay away, for you could find yourself in Fintry overnight!
